oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cal Johnson at his fountain
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Claiming Space
Leisure
African American businesspeople; African American philanthropists; Parks
Fountains; Men
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Man in a suit and flat cap, with a white beard, standing in profile next to a stone fountain that bears a plaque reading "Cal F. Johnson Park, Erected by Cal F. Johnson 1922"
Caldonia Fackler "Cal" Johnson (1844-1925) standing next to a fountain in a public park that bears his name in Knoxville, Tennessee.
